metadata.name: tpc_benchmark
metadata.description: TPC-C/TPC-E Benchmark Implementation for Solana Anchor - PoA Environment

accounts.name: new_order
docs: NewOrder to be deleted (oldest in district)
Note: In practice, the client must find the oldest o_id

accounts.name: district
docs: This is the primary serialization point for the district

accounts.name: order
docs: Order - to be created (PDA with next_o_id)
Space allocated for max 15 order lines

accounts.name: new_order
docs: NewOrder - to be created (queue entry for undelivered orders)

accounts.name: order
docs: Note: In a full implementation, we'd need to find the most recent order
For simplicity, we pass the order directly

accounts.name: customer_index
docs: Optional: Customer index for last name lookup

accounts.name: customer
docs: Note: Customer may be from different warehouse/district (15% of cases)

accounts.name: history
docs: h_id should be a unique timestamp provided by the client

accounts.name: customer_index
docs: Optional: Customer index for last name lookup
Only used when by_last_name = true (60% of cases)

accounts.name: authority
docs: Authority must be the benchmark owner

accounts.name: authority
docs: Authority must be the benchmark owner

accounts.name: district
docs: District to get next_o_id (determines recent orders)

errors.name: InvalidTaxRate
errors.msg: Tax rate must be 0-2000 basis points

errors.name: InvalidOrderLineCount
errors.msg: Order must have 5-15 items per TPC-C specification

errors.name: ItemNotFound
errors.msg: Invalid item ID - item does not exist

errors.name: OrderIdOverflow
errors.msg: Order ID overflow - district counter exhausted

errors.name: InvalidPaymentAmount
errors.msg: Invalid payment amount - must be positive

errors.name: CustomerNotFoundByLastName
errors.msg: Customer not found by last name

errors.name: NoUndeliveredOrders
errors.msg: No undelivered orders found for district

errors.name: ComputeBudgetExceeded
errors.msg: Delivery transaction would exceed compute budget

errors.name: CustomerIndexFull
errors.msg: Customer index full - too many customers with same last name

errors.name: Unauthorized
errors.msg: Unauthorized - only authority can perform this action

errors.name: AccountInUse
errors.msg: Account already in use by concurrent transaction

fields.name: warehouses
docs: Number of warehouses (W parameter - scale factor)

fields.name: districts_per_warehouse
docs: Districts per warehouse (always 10 per TPC-C spec)

fields.name: customers_per_district
docs: Customers per district (3000 per TPC-C spec)

fields.name: total_items
docs: Total items in catalog (100,000 per TPC-C spec)

fields.name: use_real_transactions
docs: Whether to use real transactions or simulation

fields.name: authority
docs: Authority who can manage the benchmark

types.name: Customer
docs: Customer account - end user who places orders
- Conflicts only when same customer makes multiple payments

fields.name: data
docs: Additional data for bad credit customers

types.name: CustomerLastNameIndex
docs: Secondary index for customer last name lookup
TPC-C requires 60% of Payment and Order-Status to lookup by last name.
Since Solana doesn't support native secondary indexes, we build one.
Handles non-unique last names by storing a vector of customer IDs.

fields.name: last_name_hash
docs: Hash of the last name (32 bytes)

fields.name: customer_ids
docs: List of customer IDs with this last name
TPC-C spec: return middle customer in sorted order

types.name: District
docs: District account - subdivision of a warehouse
- next_o_id is incremented by EVERY New-Order transaction
- All New-Order transactions for this district are SERIALIZED
- Parallelism is achieved ACROSS districts, not within

fields.name: w_id
docs: Warehouse ID (D_W_ID) - part of composite key

fields.name: tax
docs: Tax rate (D_TAX) - stored as basis points

fields.name: next_o_id
docs: This counter is the primary source of write contention
All New-Order transactions must increment this atomically

types.name: History
docs: History account - audit trail for payments

types.name: Item
docs: Item account - product in the catalog
- Safe for parallel access from all transactions

fields.name: price
docs: Item price (I_PRICE) - stored in minor units (cents)

types.name: NewOrderEntry
docs: NewOrder account - tracks orders awaiting delivery
- Deleted by Delivery (oldest undelivered order in district)
This serves as a queue: Delivery processes the oldest entry

types.name: Order
docs: Order account - customer order with embedded order lines
OPTIMIZATION: Order lines are embedded as a vector instead of separate accounts
This reduces the transaction size and account loading overhead

fields.name: all_local
docs: True if all items are from home warehouse

fields.name: lines
docs: Instead of separate ORDER_LINE accounts, embed them here

types.name: OrderLine
docs: Order line - individual item in an order
Embedded in Order account to reduce account count per transaction

fields.name: supply_w_id
docs: May differ from order's warehouse for remote orders

fields.name: amount
docs: Amount (OL_AMOUNT) - computed from item price * quantity

types.name: OrderLineInput
docs: Order line input for New-Order transaction

fields.name: supply_w_id
docs: Supply warehouse ID (may differ for remote orders)

types.name: Stock
docs: Stock account - inventory of an item at a warehouse
- Updated by EVERY New-Order that includes this item
- Popular items will have significant contention
- TPC-C uses skewed distribution (zipfian) for item selection

fields.name: dist_01
docs: Each is 24 chars, used for order line distribution info

types.name: Warehouse
docs: Warehouse account - represents a distribution center
- All payments for this warehouse contend on this account

fields.name: tax
docs: Tax rate (W_TAX) - stored as basis points (0-2000 for 0-20%)

fields.name: ytd
docs: Year-to-date balance (W_YTD) - updated by Payment transactions
This is a HOT FIELD causing write contention
